item.description: Jordan B. Kinder is a media studies and environmental humanities scholar and activist from what is now called northern British Columbia. He is a citizen of the MÃ©tis Nation of Alberta, and is currently a SSHRC-FRQSC Postdoctoral Fellow at McGill University in the Department of Art History & Communication Studies. He holds a PhD in English and Film Studies from the University of Alberta where he wrote a dissertation that studies the cultural politics of energy, media, infrastructure, and environment through a case study of the burgeoning pro-oil movement in Canada.
